ko:
A: 잘 지내시죠?
B: I'm doing great, thanks!

A: 그동안 잘 지내셨어요?
B: Yes, I've been doing well!

A: 여긴 어쩐 일이세요?
B: Just passing by and thought I'd say hi!

A: 성함을 여쭤봐도 될까요?
B: Sure, I'm Sarah.

A: 한국 음식 좋아하세요?
B: Yes, I love it!

A: 커피나 차 중 어떤 걸 선호하시나요
B: I'm definitely a coffee person.
en: Are you a coffee person or a tea person?

ko:
A: 이 동네/지역 분이신가요?
B: No, I'm just visiting.

A: 이 동네에 사시나요?
B: Yes, I've lived here for a few years.
en: Do you live in the neighborhood?

ko:
A: 여가 시간에 뭐 하시나요?
B: I like to read and go hiking.
en: What do you do in your spare time?

ko:
A: 어떤 종류의 음악을 좋아하시나요?
B: I listen to pretty much everything.
en: What kind of music do you like?

ko:
A: 여행하는 거 좋아하세요?
B: Absolutely, I try to travel whenever I can.

A: 주로 혼자 여행하세요, 아니면 다른 분들과 여행하세요?
B: I prefer traveling with friends.
en: Do you usually travel alone or with others?

ko:
A: 요가를 해보신 적 있으신가요?
B: Yes, I tried it a few times.

A: 얼마나 오래 해오셨나요?
B: About three years now.
en: How long have you been doing that?

ko:
A: 그걸 시작하게 된 계기가 있나요?
B: A friend got me into it.
en: How did you get into that?

ko:
A: 가족분들은 어떻게 지내시나요?
B: They're doing well, thanks for asking!

A: How's your father doing?
B: 부모님께 안부 전해 주세요.
en: Please say hello to your parents for me.

ko:
A: 아내분은 어떻게 만났어요?
B: We met at a friend's party.
en: How did you meet your wife?

ko:
A: 얼마나 오래 만나신 건가요?
B: We've been together for five years.
en: How long have you been together?

ko:
A: 형제/자매가 있으시나요?
B: Yes, I have one brother.

A: 언니/여동생과 사이가 좋으신가요?
B: Yes, we're very close.
en: Are you close to your sister?

ko:
A: 자녀가 있으신가요?
B: Yes, I have two kids.

A: 반려동물이 있으신가요?
B: Yes, I have a dog.

A: 근처에서 근무하시나요?
B: Yes, my office is just a few blocks away.

A: 하시는 일이 어떻게 되세요?
B: I'm a graphic designer.
en: What do you do for a living?

ko:
A: 여기에서 얼마나 근무하셨어요?
B: I've been here for about two years.
en: How long have you been working here?

ko:
A: 거긴 마음에 드시나요?
B: Yeah, I really enjoy it there.

A: 일은 어때요?
B: It's been pretty busy lately.

A: 프로젝트는 어떻게 진행되어 가요?
B: It's going well, almost done!

A: 출퇴근하는 데 얼마나 걸리나요?
B: About 30 minutes each way.
en: How long is your commute to work?

ko:
A: Have you heard the latest news?
B: Mia가 6월에 결혼한다고 들었어요!
en: I heard that Mia is getting married in June!

ko:
A: 새로 오신 매니저에 대해 어떻게 생각해요?
B: She seems really competent.
en: What do you think of the new manager?

ko:
A: 몇 시에 퇴근하세요?
B: Usually around 6 PM.
en: What time do you get off work?

ko:
A: 퇴근 후 약속 있으세요?
B: Not today, I'm free.
en: Do you have any plans after work?

ko:
A: 이번 주 가장 특별한 일이 뭐였나요?
B: I finally finished that big project.
en: What was the highlight of your week?

ko:
A: How was your day?
B: 정말 힘든 하루였어.

A: What month is it again?
B: 벌써 12월이라니 믿기지 않네요!
en: I can't believe it's already December!

ko:
A: Is it that late already?
B: 시간 가는 줄 몰랐어요.

A: 학교는 어디에서 다녀요?
B: I go to State University.
en: Where do you go to school?

ko:
A: 전공이 뭐예요?
B: I'm studying psychology.

A: 왜 그 전공을 선택했어요?
B: I've always been fascinated by how people think.
en: What made you choose your major?

ko:
A: 학교생활은 어때요?
B: It's challenging but I'm enjoying it.

A: 몇 학년이에요?
B: I'm a junior.

A: 언제 졸업해요?
B: Next spring.

A: 졸업 후 계획이 있으신가요?
B: I'm thinking about grad school.
en: Do you have any plans after graduation?

ko:
A: 기숙사에서 살아요?
B: No, I share an apartment off-campus.
en: Do you live in a dorm?

ko:
A: 여름 방학에는 뭐 할 거예요?
B: I'm planning to do an internship.
en: What are you doing for summer break?

ko:
A: 동아리 가입한 거 있어요?
B: Yes, I joined the debate club.

A: 운동하는 거 있어요?
B: I play tennis on weekends.

A: 여기 와보신 적 있으세요?
B: Yes, I come here quite often.

A: 최근에 괜찮은 영화 보신 거 있으세요?
B: I watched a great film last week.
en: Have you seen any good movies lately?

ko:
A: 영화에서 어떤 부분이 가장 마음에 드셨나요?
B: The ending was really surprising.
en: What was your favorite part of the movie?

ko:
A: 그 영화에 누가 출연해요?
B: It stars Emma Stone and Ryan Gosling.

A: 근처에 괜찮은 음식점 아시나요?
B: There's a great Italian place down the street.
en: Do you know any good restaurants around here?

ko:
A: 여기서 거기까지 얼마나 걸려요?
B: About 15 minutes by car.
en: How long does it take from here?

ko:
A: What do you think of this place?
B: 전망이 정말 좋네요!

A: 새 집은 어떻게 마음에 드세요?
B: I love it, it's so spacious!
en: How do you like your new place?

ko:
A: 지난 휴가는 어디에 다녀오셨어요?
B: We went to Hawaii.
en: Where did you go on your last vacation?

ko:
A: 지난 주말에 뭐 하셨어요?
B: I went hiking with some friends.
en: What did you do last weekend?

ko:
A: 크리스마스 때 뭐 하실 거예요?
B: I'm visiting my family.
en: What are you doing for Christmas?

ko:
A: Can you believe it's been a year already?
B: 시간 참 빨리 가네요.

A: What day is it today?
B: 주말이 코앞으로 다가왔네요.
en: The weekend is just around the corner.

ko:
A: Do you ever think about your university days?
B: 대학 시절이 그리워요.

A: What does this make you think of?
B: 이걸 보니 대학시절이 생각나네요.

A: 아직 Mia와 연락하세요?
B: Yes, we text pretty regularly.
en: Do you still talk to Mia?

ko:
A: What were you like in high school?
B: 고등학생 때 정말 열심히 공부했어요.
en: I studied a lot when I was in high school.

ko:
A: How's the weather looking?
B: 봄기운이 완연하네요.

A: How are you holding up in this heat?
B: 정말 덥네요! 녹아내릴 것 같아요.

A: 쇼핑 가시나요?
B: Yes, I need to pick up a few things.

A: How's the weather outside?
B: 밖에 정말 춥네요!

A: What do you think of this place?
B: (공간이) 좋네요/화려하네요/아늑하네요/정말 크네요.

A: 여긴 뭐가 맛있나요?
B: The pizza here is amazing.

A: What's cooking?
B: 맛있는 냄새가 나네요.

A: 파스타는 맛이 어때요?
B: It's delicious!

A: 조금 드셔 보실래요?
B: Sure, I'd love to try it!
en: Would you like to try some?

ko:
A: 그거 맛있어 보이는데 뭔가요?
B: It's lasagna.
en: That looks good. What is it?

ko:
A: What did you think of dinner?
B: 요리 정말 잘 하시네요!

A: Any recommendations for good coffee?
B: 그 카페에 한번 가보세요.
en: You should check out that cafe.

ko:
A: 화장실이 어디에 있는지 아시나요?
B: It's down the hall on the left.
en: Do you know where the restroom is?

ko:
A: 점심 식사는 맛있게 하셨나요?
B: Yes, it was great!
en: Did you have a good lunch?

ko:
A: 요즘 운동하세요?
B: Yeah, I've been going to the gym.

A: What do you think of this outfit?
B: 원피스가 마음에 드는걸요/예쁜걸요.

A: How does this look on me?
B: 그 셔츠가 잘 어울려요.
en: That shirt looks good on you.

ko:
A: 그거 어디에서 사셨나요?
B: I got it at the mall.

A: How old do you think I look?
B: 많아 봤자 35살밖에 안된 것 같아요.

A: Do I look different?
B: 조금도 안 변하셨어요.

A: 헤어스타일 바꾸셨나요?
B: Yes, I got it cut yesterday.

A: How's the new position?
B: 취업/승진 축하합니다.

A: What a coincidence seeing you here!
B: 이렇게 만나니 정말 반가운걸요!
en: I'm glad I ran into you!

ko:
A: Have you seen the movie we talked about?
B: 저번에 그 영화 봤어요.
en: I saw that movie the other day.

ko:
A: How are you feeling after that long trip?
B: 피곤하시겠어요.

A: Oliver는 어떻게 아세요?
B: We used to work together.

A: 이런 행사에 와 보신 적 있으세요?
B: No, this is my first time.
en: Have you been to an event like this before?

ko:
A: 즐거운 시간 보내고 계시나요?
B: Yes, I'm having a great time!
en: Are you having a good time?

ko:
A: It's so hot today!
B: 물 많이 드세요.

A: I have a big presentation tomorrow.
B: 잘 진행되길 바라요.

A: 새해 다짐을 무엇으로 정하셨나요?
B: I want to exercise more regularly.

A: I should get going.
B: 대화 즐거웠어요.
en: It was nice talking to you.

ko:
A: Thanks for spending time with me today.
B: 함께 해서 즐거웠어요.

A: We should hang out again soon.
B: 언제 시간 될 때 커피 한잔해요.

A: I'll be moving to another city soon.
B: 연락하고 지내요.

A: I'm heading out now.
B: 좋은 하루 보내세요!

A: See you on Monday!
B: 주말 잘 보내세요!

A: I'm leaving now.
B: 안전하게 집에 들어가세요.

A: Thanks for coming!
B: 조심해서 가세요.

A: I hope to see you again.
B: 오늘 만나서 반가웠어요.
en: It was great meeting you today.

ko:
A: Take care!
B: 나중에 또 봬요.

A: When will I see you again?
B: 곧 다시 만나요.

A: Have a good weekend!
B: 월요일에 봬요.

A: It was a great event!
B: 오늘 참석해 주셔서 감사합니다.

A: Did you have a good time?
B: 초대해 주셔서 감사합니다.

A: I really appreciate it!
B: 도와주셔서 감사합니다.

A: 어떻게 지내세요?
B: I'm doing well, thanks!

A: 오늘 기분이 어떠세요?
B: I'm feeling pretty good today.

A: 건강하게 지내셨나요?
B: Yes, I've been staying healthy.

A: How are you doing?
B: 예전만 못해요.

A: How's everything going?
B: 그럭저럭 지내요.

A: What have you been up to?
B: 정신없이 바빠요.

A: 요즘 어떻게 지내요?
B: Just the usual stuff, keeping busy.
en: What have you been up to?

ko:
A: What have you been doing lately?
B: 별일 없어요.

A: Anything new?
B: 늘 똑같죠 뭐.

A: Wow, is that really you?
B: 오랜만이에요!

A: I haven't seen you in forever!
B: 정말 오랜만이네요!

A: What are you doing here?
B: 여기서 만날 줄은 몰랐어요.
en: I didn't expect to see you here.

ko:
A: Look who's here!
B: 정말 반가워요!

A: Hi, I'm Alex.
B: 처음 뵙겠습니다.

A: I've been looking forward to meeting you.
B: 만나서 반갑습니다.
en: It's a pleasure to meet you.

ko:
A: Has anyone mentioned me?
B: 많이 들었어요.
en: I've heard a lot about you.

ko:
A: What have you heard about me?
B: 좋은 말만 들었어요.
en: I've heard great things about you.

ko:
A: 뭐라고 부르면 될까요?
B: You can call me Mike.

A: Should I call you Robert or Bob?
B: 그냥 편하게 John이라고 불러요.

A: I love this song!
B: 저도 그래요!

A: I really enjoyed that movie.
B: 저도 마찬가지예요.

A: Sometimes I feel overwhelmed by work.
B: 완전 공감해요.

A: It must have been really difficult.
B: 그럴 수 있죠.

A: What do you think?
B: 정말 그렇네요.

A: I never thought of it that way.
B: 좋은 지적이에요.

A: Have you considered this perspective?
B: 생각해 본 적 없었어요.
en: I never thought of it that way.

ko:
A: Did you know that?
B: 재미있네요!

A: She actually said yes!
B: 정말요?

A: I won the lottery!
B: 진짜요?

A: I'm thinking of quitting my job.
B: 농담이시죠?

A: They just announced a surprise holiday!
B: 믿을 수가 없네요.

A: I just ran a marathon!
B: 놀랍네요!

A: I learned three languages in a year.
B: 대단하네요!

A: I got the promotion!
B: 멋지네요!

A: I finally finished my thesis!
B: 잘됐네요!

A: I got accepted to my dream school!
B: 정말 잘하셨어요!

A: I didn't get the job.
B: 유감이에요.

A: The concert was cancelled.
B: 안됐네요.

A: I'm going through a tough time.
B: 힘내세요.

A: I'm worried about the interview.
B: 다 잘될 거예요.

A: Sorry about the mess.
B: 걱정 마세요.

A: I hope I didn't bother you.
B: 괜찮아요.

A: Thanks for helping me out.
B: 문제없어요.

A: Thank you so much for everything!
B: 천만에요.

A: I really appreciate your help.
B: 아무것도 아니에요.

A: How much do I owe you?
B: 제 차례예요.

A: Can I pay you back?
B: 제가 살게요.

A: You paid last time.
B: 다음엔 제가 살게요.

A: Should we split the bill?
B: 각자 내요.

A: 배고프지 않으세요?
B: Actually, I'm starving!

A: Should we get something to eat?
B: 배고파 죽겠어요.

A: Would you like some more?
B: 너무 배불러요.

A: Can I get you anything?
B: 목말라요.

A: 물 한 잔 마실래요?
B: Yes, please!

A: 뭐 마실 거 있어요?
B: Just water, please.
en: Can I get you something to drink?

ko:
A: Would you like some more coffee?
B: 저 괜찮아요, 감사합니다.

A: Are you sure you don't want anything?
B: 저는 됐어요.

A: How much would you like?
B: 조금만요.

A: Is that enough?
B: 충분해요, 감사합니다.

A: Are you okay?
B: 피곤해 보이시네요.

A: 잘 주무셨나요?
B: Yes, I slept great!

A: You look exhausted. What happened?
B: 어젯밤에 잠을 잘 못 잤어요.
en: I didn't sleep well last night.

ko:
A: You've been working all day.
B: 좀 쉬는 게 어때요?
en: Why don't you take a break?

ko:
A: How are you holding up?
B: 휴식이 필요해요.

A: You seem stressed.
B: 휴가가 필요해요.

A: 스트레스 받으세요?
B: A little bit, yeah.

A: Is everything okay?
B: 요즘 스트레스가 많아요.

A: What are you going to do?
B: 기분 전환이 필요해요.
en: I need to clear my head.

ko:
A: How's the weather today?
B: 날씨가 정말 좋네요!

A: What do you think of this weather?
B: 날씨가 완벽하네요.

A: Should we stay inside?
B: 밖에 나가기 딱 좋은 날씨네요.
en: It's a great day to be outside.

ko:
A: Look at those clouds.
B: 비 올 것 같아요.
en: It looks like it's going to rain.

ko:
A: 우산 가져오셨나요?
B: No, I forgot it.

A: 오늘 날씨 어때요?
B: It's beautiful and sunny!

A: 꽃가루 알레르기 있으세요?
B: Yes, I do unfortunately.

A: What's your favorite season?
B: 봄이 제일 좋아요.

A: What are you looking forward to?
B: 여름이 기다려져요.

A: Have you seen outside?
B: 가을 단풍이 정말 예쁘죠.

A: How do you feel about winter?
B: 겨울은 너무 추워요.
en: Winter is too cold for me.

ko:
A: 눈 오는 거 좋아하세요?
B: I love it when it snows!

A: How was the drive?
B: 교통이 정말 막히네요.

A: 출근길이 어땠어요?
B: It was pretty smooth today.

A: 보통 어떻게 출근하세요?
B: I usually drive.
en: How do you usually get to work?

ko:
A: How do you get to work?
B: 지하철 타고 와요.

A: Do you drive to work?
B: 걸어서 다녀요.

A: Do you go to an office?
B: 재택근무해요.

A: 재택근무가 어때요?
B: I really enjoy the flexibility.
en: How do you like working from home?

ko:
A: What do you think of remote work?
B: 장단점이 있죠.
en: It has its pros and cons.
